levels.4: Clearly identifies a real-world business problem and provides an innovative, well-researched solution.
levels.3: Identifies a relevant business problem and proposes a feasible solution with some innovation.
levels.2: Defines a general problem but lacks clarity or depth in the proposed solution.
levels.1: Problem definition is vague or disconnected from a practical business context.

levels.4: Demonstrates advanced use of LLMs, APIs, and/or no-code tools; solution is robust and well-optimized.
levels.3: Effectively uses LLMs, APIs, and/or no-code tools; solution is functional with minor optimization issues.
levels.2: Basic use of LLMs, APIs, or no-code tools; solution has functional gaps or inefficiencies.
levels.1: Minimal or incorrect use of LLMs, APIs, or no-code tools; solution is incomplete or non-functional.

levels.4: User-friendly, visually appealing interface with seamless functionality and responsiveness.
levels.3: Functional interface with good usability and design but minor inconsistencies.
levels.2: Interface is functional but lacks usability or visual appeal; may have significant flaws.
levels.1: Interface is poorly designed, difficult to use, or non-functional.

levels.4: Clear roles and responsibilities; excellent teamwork and communication throughout the project.
levels.3: Defined roles and good teamwork; occasional communication issues but resolved effectively.
levels.2: Roles are somewhat unclear; teamwork was inconsistent with some communication challenges.
levels.1: Roles are undefined; poor teamwork and lack of communication hindered project progress.

levels.4: Fully deployed application accessible internally/publicly; performs reliably under testing.
levels.3: Deployed application accessible internally/publicly; minor performance issues during testing.
levels.2: Partially deployed application with limited accessibility or significant performance issues.
levels.1: Application not deployed or inaccessible for testing/review purposes.

levels.4: Comprehensive documentation covering all aspects of the project, including setup instructions and challenges faced.
levels.3: Sufficient documentation covering most aspects of the project with minor gaps in detail or clarity.
levels.2: Basic documentation provided but lacks depth or clarity in explaining key aspects of the project.
levels.1: Minimal or missing documentation; difficult to understand or replicate the project setup.

levels.4: Highly creative and innovative solution that demonstrates original thinking and problem-solving.
levels.3: Creative solution with some original ideas that address the business problem effectively.
levels.2: Solution shows limited creativity and relies on standard approaches without much innovation.
levels.1: Solution lacks creativity and originality; does not effectively address the identified problem.
